channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Thu, 10 Oct 2024 20:59:44 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Oops' moment for BBC: Apology issued after weather app gaffe shows 'hurricane winds' in London
item.description: The BBC apologizes for a technical error in its weather app that incorrectly forecasted extreme weather conditions, including hurricane-force winds and temperatures of 404°C. The Met Office provides accurate updates, noting the UK's expected weather and ruling out the current possibility of hurricane impacts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taiwan’s president signals he’ll stand up to China challenge
item.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te vowed to combat challenges from China, affirming Taiwan’s sovereignty during his National Day speech. He emphasized maintaining peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait while expressing willingness to collaborate on various issues, including climate change. Lai also addressed high housing prices, promising measures to control the market.

item.title: UK Rapper and influencer Yung Filly arrested over rape and assault allegations in Australia
item.description: British rapper Yung Filly, facing serious charges of rape and assault, appeared in a Perth court. His bail was contested due to his extensive social media following and financial resources, raising concerns about witness interference and flight risk. A decision on bail is pending, with proposed measures to restrict social media activity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Teachers in Texas use sleeping patches on 4-year-olds
item.description: Two teachers at Northgate Crossing Elementary in Texas were removed and are under police investigation after allegedly using melatonin-infused stickers to calm students. Parents reported disrupted sleeping patterns and other issues in their children. The school has placed the teachers and two paraprofessionals on administrative leave and confirmed the violation of medication policy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It's a live broadcast': Harris stumbles during hurricane Milton meeting; MAGA says 'total incompetence'
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris faces criticism after a Hurricane Milton briefing with FEMA, where she appeared to struggle during a live broadcast. Harris, along with President Joe Biden, was updated on the hurricane's forecast and potential impacts in Florida. MAGA supporters criticized her, citing apparent signs of unpreparedness and reliance on notes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pro-Russian 'sleeper agent' bots on X push US election misinformation: Study
item.description: Hundreds of pro-Russian bot accounts on X have been spreading misinformation about the US election and Democratic candidate Kamala Harris, according to the American Sunlight Project. Some of these bots, active for up to 15 years, promote pro-Kremlin propaganda and support Donald Trump. Data restrictions after Elon Musk’s acquisition of X have made tracking these bots challenging.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Trying to spark chaos': US Republicans on hurricane misinformation spread by own party members
item.description: Several congressional Republicans, including Representatives Chuck Edwards and Carlos Gimenez, are speaking out against conspiracy theories about weather manipulation spread by their own party members, particularly Marjorie Taylor Greene. They emphasize the need for fact-checking and relying on reputable sources during natural disasters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sean Diddy's legal team accuse US government of leaking Cassie assault footage
item.description: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' attorneys accuse federal agents of leaking surveillance footage showing him abusing ex-girlfriend Cassie, leading to public outrage and a forced apology. They argue that the leak harms Combs' chance for a fair trial. Prosecutors deem the footage key evidence, linking it to charges of sex trafficking and more. Combs denies all allegations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Milton hits Florida, leaving over 1 million without power
item.description: Hurricane Milton made landfall in Florida as a Category 3 storm, bringing 120 mph winds, a deadly storm surge, and widespread flooding. Over 1 million homes are without power, and 5.5 million residents were ordered to evacuate. Governor DeSantis and President Biden have urged residents to take the storm seriously.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Youth facing unprecedented wave of violence, UN envoy warns
item.description: Young people are increasingly subjected to violence and sexual abuse due to war, climate change, hunger, and displacement, according to UN's Najat Maalla M'jid. Her forthcoming report highlights the severity of the crisis, urging coordinated international efforts to address the multifaceted issues affecting children's safety and well-being.

item.title: Saudi Arabia loses bid for seat on UN's premier human rights body
item.description: Saudi Arabia failed to secure a seat in the UN Human Rights Council following accusations of serious rights violations by rights groups. The 193-member General Assembly elected 18 new council members from regional groups to ensure geographical representation, with Thailand, Cyprus, Qatar, South Korea, and Marshall Islands taking the Asia-Pacific seats.

item.title: Biden, Netanyahu spoke for 30 minutes; it was direct, honest, productive: White House
item.description: ​The call comes amid tensions between Biden and Netanyahu and was their first since August 21, a seven-week gap during which Israel also launched an offensive against Hezbollah in Lebanon. Biden has cautioned Israel against attempting to target Iran's nuclear program and is also against a strike on the country's oil installations, which would send oil prices spiking less than a month before the US presidential election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harry wants to sit down and talk with Meghan Markle about future as...
item.description: Harry extended his abroad trip while Meghan made a surprise appearance at a Red Carpet event in California where she wore a bold, red dress in an attempt to send a message of her own individual identity -- apart from Harry and the Royal Family. In fact, experts said her choice of dress was a message to the Royal Family and Hollywood that she is not hiding and ready to reinvent herself.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kansas University staff on camera says males who don't vote for Kamala Harris should be shot
item.description: A Kansas University professor was placed on administrative leave after a recorded class session in which he suggested men who wouldn't vote for a female president should be shot. The instructor expressed deep regret, and the university said it is investigating the incident placing the instructor on leave. "His intent was to emphasize his advocacy for women's rights and equality, and he recognizes he did a very poor job of doing so. The university has an established process for situations like this and will follow that process," the university said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Netanyahu speaks to US President Biden as Israel mulls action against Iran
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu spoke to US President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris as Israel prepares to retaliate against Iran's missile attack. Defence Minister Yoav Gallant promised a lethal, precise, and surprising response, while Netanyahu reached out to Iranians, criticizing their government.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Diddy to seek trial date in April, May 2025; will move against leaks of jury information: Latest updates
item.description: Diddy's lawyers plan to seek a trial date for April or May 2025, while also addressing unauthorized grand jury leaks. The government is coordinating discovery, which includes several terabytes of electronic materials. Diddy asserts his right to a speedy trial and demands timely production of his seized devices. The government said the discovery in the case has been voluminous, totaling several terabytes of electronic materials including cellphones, laptops, tablets and cloud accounts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Influencer slammed for refusing to evacuate for Hurricane Milton: 'I have champagne'
item.description: Caroline explained that she would not be evacuating as she can't drive and then the airport is closed. “Third of all, the last time I evacuated for a hurricane, I went to my mom’s house in Northport for Hurricane Ian … Her whole street flooded and we were evacuated after three days without power or running water by the US military,” she said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania makes this gesture when asked about Trump's nightdress: Watch
item.description: ​Former First Lady Melania Trump appeared on Fox News to promote her memoir 'Melania' and was asked intimate details about Donald Trump. The speculations that not everything is alright between Melania and Donald have been put to rest for the time being as Melania wrote a great deal about Donald Trump in her book and the former president is also praises about Melania and her memoir.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Barron Trump was denied a bank account due to 'cancel mob', reveals Melania in memoir
item.description: Melania Trump revealed that Barron Trump was denied a new bank account following the Capitol Riots in 2021. “This decision appeared to be rooted in political discrimination, raising serious concerns about civil rights violations," Melania wrote without naming the bank. “The ‘cancel mob’ now includes corporations, traditional media, influential social media figures, and cultural institutions,” Melania wrote. “This disheartening trend reflects the current socio-political landscape in the United States.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Donald Trump can't praise Elon Musk's waistline enough; 'Does he work out?'
item.description: ​Elon is a piece of work, Donald Trump said when at the interview he was asked whether Elon Musk was his favorite African-American. "Elon is a great guy. He is obviously a brilliant guy...He's got a great heart...I have a lot of people who are big supporters of me but they won't go all out. There's a cost and liability also. But this guy was jumping on the stage saying you gotta vote for Trump," the former president said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
